summary: The "Assuring Medicare’s Promise Act of 2025" amends the Social Security Act and the Internal Revenue Code to bolster the Medicare program.  It directs net investment income tax revenue to the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund. It also modifies the net investment income tax, applying it more broadly to include certain high-income individuals and expanding the definition of income subject to the tax.  The changes primarily impact tax regulations related to investment income and their relation to Medicare funding.
